name: International football results from 1872 to 2024
data_intro: This dataset includes **47,917** results of international football matches starting from the very first official match in 1872 up to 2024. The matches range from FIFA World Cup to FIFI Wild Cup to regular friendly matches. The matches are strictly men's full internationals and the data does not include Olympic Games or matches where at least one of the teams was the nation's B-team, U-23 or a league select team.

cat_feature_intro.current: Note on team and country names: For home and away teams the *current* name of the team has been used. For example, when in 1882 a team who called themselves Ireland played against England, in this dataset, it is called Northern Ireland because the current team of Northern Ireland is the successor of the 1882 Ireland team. This is done so it is easier to track the history and statistics of teams.
cat_feature_intro.former: [This notebook](https://www.kaggle.com/code/martj42/basic-use-of-former-names-csv) shows the basics of how to use *former_names.csv*
cat_feature_intro.start_date: -   `start_date` - start date of when former name was used
cat_feature_intro.end_date: -   `end_date` - end date of when former name was used
cat_feature_intro.date: If you notice a mistake or the results are not updated fast enough for your liking, you can fix that by submitting a pull request on Github: https://github.com/martj42/international_results
cat_feature_intro.home_team: -   `home_team` - the name of the home team
cat_feature_intro.away_team: -   `away_team` - the name of the away team
cat_feature_intro.team: -   Which teams are the most active in playing friendlies and friendly tournaments - does it help or hurt them
cat_feature_intro.scorer: -   `scorer` - name of the player scoring the goal
cat_feature_intro.tournament: -   Which teams are the most active in playing friendlies and friendly tournaments - does it help or hurt them
cat_feature_intro.city: -   `city` - the name of the city/town/administrative unit where the match was played
cat_feature_intro.country: -   How much, if at all, does hosting a major tournament help a country's chances in the tournament
cat_feature_intro.first_shooter: -   `first_shooter` - the team that went first in the shootout

num_feature_intro.own_goal: -   `own_goal` - whether the goal was an own-goal
num_feature_intro.penalty: -   `penalty` - whether the goal was a penalty
num_feature_intro.home_score: -   `home_score` - full-time home team score including extra time, not including penalty-shootouts
num_feature_intro.away_score: -   `away_score` - full-time away team score including extra time, not including penalty-shootouts
num_feature_intro.neutral: For country names, the name of the country *at the time of the match* is used. So when Ghana played in Accra, Gold Coast in the 1950s, even though the names of the home team and the country don't match, it was a home match for Ghana. This is indicated by the neutral column, which says FALSE for those matches, meaning it was **not** at a neutral venue.
